de.lmu.ifi.nm.www

Class RMIRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.nm.www.RMIRegistry

  • public class RMIRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Graceful RMI registry creation/reuse. Tries to reuse an existing one but is fine with creating one on another port.

    • Method Detail

      • selectGracefully

        public RMIRegistry selectGracefully()
        This will make sure a registry exists and is valid m_port. If its not available or does not work for some reason, it will select another port. This should really not happen usually. But it can.
        Returns:
        this for fluent API. Or IllegalStateException if a port has not been detected successfully.

      • printTakenStatus

        private void printTakenStatus()

      • select

        private java.lang.Integer select(int port)
        This contains basically two paths: 1. check if the given port already is valid rmi registry. Use that one if possible 2. make a new one at that port otherwise. Must also be validated.
        Parameters:
        port - to select.
        Returns:
        input port if successful or UNSELECTED

        private boolean createNewRegistry(int port)
